alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; McIntosh; Muskogee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 12:50PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern McIntosh, southeastern Wagoner, western Cherokee and Muskogee Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1250 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Porter to 5 miles south of Council Hill. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Warner... Okay... Porter... Oktaha... Taft... Boynton... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Tullahassee... Lake Eufaula State Park... Sequoyah State Park... Keefeton... Wainwright... Summit... Jamesville... Choska... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 254 and 280. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
